transcripts.text: Quentin.  Quentin is out of Maryland.  Quentin, thank you for holding.  You're on the air.
Yeah, I just had a question.  Don, you repeat the same stuff over and over every day so much that it almost becomes like a walking contradiction.
A walking contradiction?
Yeah, because...
What's a walking contradiction?
You brought up Friday about the shooting in New Zealand, okay?
Yes.

And then you'll say, don't get angry.  It's not to be angry.  It's about good and evil.  And then you'll say, well, over here in America, you know, you shouldn't get angry.  If you do, it might turn out to a situation like the New Zealand situation.  But in the same sentence, you'll go, in the same sentence, you'll turn around and say, But the blacks hate the white people.  Immigrants hate white people.  Muslims hate white people.  So then you turn around and fuel the same fire that you claim you're trying to put out.
Where's the contradiction?  I don't see it.

Because how can you tell people not to get angry, not to whatever, and you're still fueling the fire?  Because you can call someone to get angry.  The same way that white guy, because the people are going off on you after you wrote your article.  Saying that you're the bad guy.  And honestly, let's be honest here for a second.  The reason people despise white people is because they've been doing so much damage and crooked stuff and destruction forever.  That's why people have a problem with them.
That's why you have a problem with white people?
Say what?
That's why you have a problem with white people?
I deal with people the way they deal with me.
Do you have a problem with white people?
Oh, yeah, I do have a problem with white people because they have been that way for a very long time.
What have they done to you?  What have you done to me lately?
Ooh, yeah.
What have they done to you?
I've been arrested without being falsely accused of stuff I hadn't done.
What have they done to you?  White people didn't do that to you.  First of all, I don't believe it.
Yeah, white people did it, so you weren't there to know.
No, white people did not do that to you.  You're lying.
Yeah, white people did do that.
No, they didn't.
But, hey, just because you assemble and believe everything white people do, that's up to you.
But you're lying.  White people didn't do that to you.
Yeah, well, they didn't.  But anyway, back to what I was saying.
No, they didn't.  And by the way, no one, another lie.  you're telling, no one can make you angry.
You feel the same fire that you tell people not to have.
Quentin, no one can make you angry, Quentin.
It's contradictory.
You're lying.  You ain't show me no contradiction.  You ain't show me one contradiction.
You feel the fire of the same fire you claim to put out.
Quentin, listen.
Well, put it this way.  I want you to get your country back.  I want you to have your country back, like you said.  You want your country back, and I want it to go back to those days.
The good old days.

When they see you hanging from a tree.  And I want to bring the beer, and I want to be the one to kick the chair.  That's what I want to do.  That's what I want to do.  You're evil.  I want you to get your country back.  That's what I want.  You're evil.  And I want to be there, like I said, to bring the Budweiser and kick the chair when they do.  That goes for Joel and that other boyfriend, them two other boyfriends you got.  This is what I want to do.

Oh, goodbye.  Amazing.  He black.  First of all, no one can make you angry, folks.  They only bring it out what's already there.  And I'm trying to stop the fire by telling black people and all people, but especially black people, that you are, your anger is what's getting you in trouble, making you do crazy things.  And white people didn't do that.  Your mama did that, your daddy.  And don't blame the whites, they didn't do that.  You're being used by others because you're in a fallen state to blame other people.  So he cursed at me, right?  Huh?  He sure did.  Quentin did.  He sure did.  And Quentin said that... He's Sambo.  And he said that he would like the good old days to come back so that the white people can hang me from a tree and he could be sitting there with a beer and kick the chair.  Right.  The stool I'll be standing on.  Isn't that amazing?  No love at all.
